thread.title: AFC Wimbledon chief blasts fans for 'damaging' club's reputation with banner labelling Karl Robinson a 'lying c***'
thread.title_full: AFC Wimbledon chief blasts fans for 'damaging' club's reputation with banner labelling Karl Robinson a 'lying c***'

author: John Cross
title: AFC Wimbledon chief blasts fans for 'damaging' club's reputation with banner labelling Karl Robinson a 'lying c***'
text:
Sport AFC Wimbledon chief blasts fans for 'damaging' club's reputation with banner labelling Karl Robinson a 'lying c***' Erik Samuelson says the Dons will do their best to prevent a repeat after shameful scenes marred their League One clash against Charlton Share Robinson was targeted by the banner held by AFC Wimbledon fans (Photo: REX/Shutterstock) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Wimbledon chief executive Erik Samuelson has admitted club’s fans have “damaged’ their reputation after shameful scenes marred their clash with Charlton. 
Football Association chiefs have asked both Wimbledon and Charlton for their observations after Mirror Sport reported Addicks boss Karl Robinson had been confronted at the end of the game. 
Incredibly, a member of Wimbledon’s ground staff made an obscene and insulting remark towards Robinson’s family. 
Wimbledon fans also held up a banner for the majority of the game calling Robinson a “lying c**” because he used to be in charge of their bitter rivals MK Dons. Robinson used to manage Wimbledon's fierce rivals MK Dons (Photo: Mike Hewitt) Read More Charlton's ex-MK Dons manager Karl Robinson subjected to 'appalling' abuse by Wimbledon staff during match 
Samuelson issued a statement on Monday condemning the banner. 
“The people who did this have damaged our hard-won reputation among our own fans as well as football fans everywhere," he said. 
"We will do our utmost to prevent a repetition.” Like us on Facebook
